comment: When ` a ` is coprime to the prime ` p ` , ` a ^ ( ( p - 1 ) / 2 ) ` is equivalent ` mod p ` to ` 1 ` or ` -u 1 ` , and so adding ` 1 ` makes it equivalent to ` 0 ` or ` 2 ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Feb-2015.)
